Posted By: GruesomeGoo (12/30/2009 12:16:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Don't be fooled, this thing did its fair share of smashing. It saw play in a good many competitive decks of the time.  
In the context in which it existed, lowering CMC and/or raising power would have been problematic. Plus, its worth noting that this has an *incredibly* flexible mana cost when compared to a hybrid like [Boggart Ram-Gang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boggart Ram-Gang), which can really only be supported by a red, green, or red/green deck.  
Also, love the name Cap'n Tickles :)
posts.html:

Posted By: metalevolence (4/8/2010 3:26:39 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Was a really powerful card, and one that I absolutely loved. Too often this is a Lightning Blast to the face first, followed by the opponent's desperated attempt to find something to block it. All its power came from its shroud - the safest way to deal with a Ball Lightning is to save a Bolt for it, but the Bolt would stay dead against Giant Solifuge. Blockers have always been the poor man's choice, as they can be burned or even Frenzied away, but they are the *only* choice when it comes to stopping this beast. And then it's 4 to the dome, threatening to at least trample over with another 4, and that's when they do manage to get a decent blocker.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: What imperialstonedragon said. Solifugae are arachnids. They are more related to spiders and scorpions. I know that merging them to an "arachnid" creature type would seem to scientific and not fantasy enough but you could at least make it a spider as it is not an insect. It is not like there are not any other spiders without reach.
